sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• carefully evaluate triglyceride levels prior to initiating therapy.
  • Hypertriglyceridemia, Adjunct to diet in adults with triglyceride levels 500 mg/dL or higher: 2 or 4 g (2 or 4 capsules) ORALLY once daily; individualize therapy based on patient response and tolerability

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: safety and effectiveness not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono: geriatrics: initiate therapy at the lower end of the dosage range

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Hypertriglyceridemia, Adjunct to diet in adults with triglyceride levels 500 mg/dL or higher

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to omega-3-carboxylic acids or to any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Endocrine and metabolic:
  • -- increased LDL-C levels have been reported; monitoring recommended
  • Hepatic:
  • -- monitoring recommended in patients with hepatic impairment
  • Immunologic:
  • -- hypersensitivity to fish or shellfish because product is derived from fish oils

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (7% to 15%), Nausea (4% to 6%)
Serious
Endocrine metabolic:Raised low density lipoprotein cholesterol

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: The exact mechanism of action of omega-3-carboxylic acids is unknown. Possible mechanisms include: increased liver mitochondrial beta-oxidation, increased plasma lipoprotein lipase activity, inhibition of acyl-CoA:1,2-diacylglycerol acyltransferase, and decreased liver lipogenesis. Furthermore, omega-3-carboxylic acids may decrease the production of liver triglycerides because they are poor substrates for the enzymes that participate in triglyceride synthesis, and they inhibit esterification of other fatty acids.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA): 5 to 8 hours
  • Tmax, docosahexaenoic acid (DHA): 5 to 9 hours
  • Effects of food, docosahexaenoic acid (DHA): No change in AUC
  • Effects of food, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA): Increased AUC

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal: None
  • Total body clearance, DHA: 518 mL/hr
  • Total body clearance, EPA: 548 mL/hr

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • take with or without food
  • swallow capsules whole without dissolving or chewing

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• reduction in fasting triglyceride levels indicate efficacy
  • LDL-C levels; periodically during therapy
  • AST and ALT; periodically in patients with hepatic impairment

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Warn patient that drug is derived from fish oils. Use caution in patients with fish or shellfish allergies.
  • Side effects may include diarrhea, nausea, abdominal pain or discomfort, or eructation.
  • Advise patient to swallow capsule whole. Do not crush, chew, dissolve, or open.
  • Instruct patient to adhere to dietary requirements.
